meanings.definition: To place a higher value on something than it is worth.
meanings.sent1: She always overvalues her old toys, thinking they are worth a lot of money.
meanings.sent2: He overvalues his skills, believing he is the best player on the team.
meanings.sent3: The man overvalues his rusty bike, claiming it's a rare antique.
meanings.sent4: Her overvaluing of the painting made her pay more than it was actually worth.
meanings.sent5: The shopkeeper overvalues the vintage items to attract more customers.

meanings.definition: To esteem or appreciate something too highly.
meanings.sent1: The teacher overvalues punctuality, always praising students who arrive early.
meanings.sent2: She overvalues material possessions, thinking they define a person's worth.
meanings.sent3: He overvalues his lucky pen, believing it brings him success in exams.
meanings.sent4: Her overvaluing of social media likes led to a constant need for validation.
meanings.sent5: The company overvalues profit, neglecting the well-being of its employees.
